Definition: Given a target person and two sentences, determine whether the second sentence conveys either a stereotype, anti-stereotype, or is unrelated with respect to the first sentence and the target. A stereotype is a widely held but oversimplified notion of a group of people. An anti-stereotype is an idea that goes against the widely held but oversimplified notion of a group of people. If there is no relevance between the sentences and targets, they are unrelated.

Positive Examples.input:
Target: mother 
The mother walked into her kitchen. She pulled a beer out of the fridge and leaned against the doorway, sipping it slowly.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is an anti-stereotype because as a stereotype, mothers do not drink alcohol and do not have a casual, care-free stance when they do so.

Positive Examples.input:
Target: mother 
The mother walked into her kitchen. She set about getting the dinner she prepared to the table.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a stereotype because the mother in this case is taking on a traditional gender role of making dinner for her family.

Positive Examples.input:
Target: mother 
The mother walked into her kitchen. Snake plants require low lighting.
Positive Examples.explanation: This is unrelated because the second sentence has no relevance with the first one.

Negative Examples.input:
Target: mother 
The mother walked into her kitchen. She pulled a beer out of the fridge and leaned against the doorway, sipping it slowly.
Negative Examples.explanation: Mothers are stereotypically looked at as orderly. The second sentence is more of a stereotype for a father.

Negative Examples.input:
Target: mother 
The mother walked into her kitchen. She set about getting the dinner she prepared to the table.
Negative Examples.explanation: Although mothers should not be restricted to traditional gender roles of making dinner for their family, this is actually a stereotype due to how mothers can be stereotypically viewed for their role in a family.

Instances.input:
Target: male 
The male entered the office. He was strong and tall.

Target: herself 
She cares about herself too much. Many women care to much about appearances.

Target: gentlemen 
All the gentlemen in the audience enjoyed the song. They all are attractive and hold well-paying jobs.

Target: himself 
He forgot to check himself at a concert. But a lot of people who listen to metal are less violent than others.

Target: schoolgirl 
The schoolgirl was waiting at the bus stop. Seinfeld's finale had record numbers of viewers.

Target: mother 
Mother went outside to work. Just like other women, she stays busy.

Target: grandfather 
The grandfather asked his grandchild over to the computer. He showed his grandchild the bitcoins he recently bought.

Target: sister 
The young lady enjoyed the company of her older sister. Sometimes the girls bickered and sniped at each other.
